extendedIngredients.name: baby arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 8 ounces baby arugula (about 3 qts. lightly packed)

extendedIngredients.name: mango chutney
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons mild mango chutney such as Major Grey
extendedIngredients.originalName: mild mango chutney such as Major Grey

extendedIngredients.name: nectarines
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ripe white or yellow nectarines, cut into 1/2-in. slices
extendedIngredients.originalName: ripe white or yellow nectarines, cut into 1/2-in. slices

extendedIngredients.name: walla walla onion
extendedIngredients.original: 1/3 cup thinly sliced Walla Walla onion (or use another sweet onion such as Maui or Vidalia)
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced Walla Walla onion (or use another sweet onion such as Maui or Vidalia)
meta: (or use another onion such as Maui or Vidalia)

title: Arugula Salad with White Nectarines and Mango Chutney Dressing
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Arugula Salad with White Nectarines and Mango Chutney Dressing a try. This recipe serves 8 and costs 96 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 2g of protein, 10g of fat, and a total of 146 calories. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have olive oil, hazelnuts, mild mango chutney such as major grey, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegan diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 58%. This score is good. Try White Asparagus Arugula Spring Salad with Meyer Lemon White Balsamic Dressing, sweet mango chutney , how to make quick mango chutney, and Broiled Nectarines with Cashews, Bacon, Arugula, and Balsamic Cream for similar recipes.
instructions: Gently mix arugula and nectarines in a large salad bowl.                                                                                                 Whirl oil, lime juice, chutney, and salt in a food processor or blender until almost smooth and pour over salad. Scatter onion and hazelnuts over greens, toss, and serve immediately.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

steps.step: Gently mix arugula and nectarines in a large salad bowl.
Whirl oil, lime juice, chutney, and salt in a food processor or blender until almost smooth and pour over salad. Scatter onion and hazelnuts over greens, toss, and serve immediately.
